subject: Re: [junit] German book on Junit and test first ready for review
msgSnippet: ... I haven t read the entire book (did quick overview + read the chapter about JUnit) but this book presents the testing methodology and not only JUnit.  I
messageBody:
> > In the world of languages, there is English and there is also French,
> > German, Hindi... Several books already exist in English so one in
> > German cannot arm.
>
> While I have many books that mention JUnit, I have yet to read one that
> is about JUnit. Any recommendations. Alas, being a parochial American,
> English is the only language in which I can read technical books.

I haven't read the entire book (did quick overview + read the chapter about JUnit) but this book presents the testing methodology and not only JUnit. I don't think that you can write 200+ pages about JUnit. The chapter about JUnit is about 20 pages and describes how to write a test case, a suite and execute tests. Nothing new if you have access to the documentation.

What is more interesting about this book is the presentation of several testing methods (mock objects for ex.). I think this book is worth reading but if you don't want to learn German (...) you will find plenty of other books written in a language you better understand.

-Vladimir
